headline: Tea App Was Meant to Protect Women. It Couldn’t Protect Their Data.
summary: Tea—a viral new app that’s meant to make women feel safe while using online dating services—has been subject to a security breach that exposed users’ IDs.  Tea confirmed the breach to Barron’s. In a statement, the company said that it identified unauthorized access to one of its systems and immediately launched an investigation to assess the impact.  Preliminary findings indicate that the incident involved a legacy data storage system containing information from over two years ago, Tea said.
